title: Project Engineer
job_description: DescriptionPosting Title: Project Engineer - Data Center ConstructionReports To: Project ManagerLocation: Desoto, KSSalary Range: $65,000 to $85,000Final determination of a successful candidate’s starting pay will vary based on a number of factors, including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, education and experience. The pay scale listed for this position is generally for candidates that meet the specified qualifications and requirements listed on this specific job description. We provide a competitive compensation package that recognizes your experience, credentials, and education alongside a robust benefits program to meet your needs. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets.Who We AreFor nearly 70 years, Cupertino Electric, Inc. (CEI) has been powered by people who’ve built a reputation for delivering high-profile, complex projects. Real, tangible things that alter the landscape and improve lives. But even more than that, we’ve built a reputation for integrity. We’re problem solvers and innovation seekers. We’re team players and safety fanatics. And we always—always—do the right thing. Even when no one is looking. Because what we do here is important, but how we do it is everything.THE DATA CENTER TEAMWe build mission-critical data centers throughout the U.S. to ensure crucial information accessed by millions of people is always available and secure. For two decades, CEI has designed, installed and commissioned more than 11.5 million square feet of data center space totaling $2.3 billion worth of electrical systems.About The RoleWe’re seeking a Project Engineer ready to be on the front lines of a project--giving daily support to the field, project management, and customer teams. Our Project Engineers (PE) are vital in keeping our processes moving along and assists in the execution of project plans. This role will be responsible for specific activities such as coordinating material onsite delivery dates, maintaining RFI, submittals, and change order logs, and will serve as a key point of contact for internal customers.Knowledge: Learns to use professional concepts. Applies company policies and procedures to resolve routine issues.Job Complexity: Works on problems of limited scope. Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained. Builds stable working relationships internally.Supervision: Normally receives detailed instructions on all work.About YouYou are willing and excited to learn—with a continuous focus on cultivating a growth mindset. You bring a wide range of skills from being organized to communicating through various channels and collaborating with your team members. You are comfortable taking initiative and ownership of your work. You are not afraid to throw on a pair of boots and your protective personal equipment (PPE)—safety first!What You Will GainAt Cupertino Electric you’ll be on a career development path to project management. You’ll work directly for a project manager or project executive on a team that partners with field, engineering, and design teams. It’s ok if you don’t have a deep understanding of electrical construction, just be ready to learn and get fired up. You'll have the opportunity to soak up knowledge from everyone you work with – from the journeyman and general foreman to the project team assigning daily tasks. In addition to on-the-job experience and mentoring from your peers, you’ll attend vendor off sites, training classes, and other learning opportunities.Minimum QualificationsAny combination of education and experience that, in the sole judgment and discretion of Company, would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications may qualify.Education: High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Business, Engineering, or similar preferred.Licensure/Certifications: None required.Experience: Zero (0) years of construction or related experience required. Two (2) years of construction or related experience preferred.Driving Record: Valid state-issued driver’s license and satisfactory driving record.Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. This position is not eligible for sponsorship.PLEASE NOTE: CEI will never ask for any money or financial information from applicants during the hiring process. To learn more about "job scams" how to avoid them, click here.CEI is a place where every single person can—and does—have an impact on the work we do and the communities we serve. Here, you can build your own story and grow to your full potential. You can collaborate and celebrate with amazing people. And you’ll go home every day knowing you helped contribute to important work that shapes people’s lives. Our commercial, data center and energy projects may be complex, but our approach is simple. We build great things and we do it with great people.The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department, program or project needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.Cupertino Electric, Inc. (CEI) is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.Cupertino Electric Inc. aims to make cei.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, please contact us at [email protected] or 1-(877)-747-4CEI.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Backend
job_description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch : Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best candidate for our clients. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire.Our ClientOur client is an innovative, venture-backed health-tech startup operating in stealth mode.They are building the modern financial OS for the new era of healthcare. In this era, humans and machines collaborate seamlessly to deliver effective and efficient patient care. However, to realize this vision, we must tackle a core industry-wide challenge: the fragmented financial data within healthcare practices. Our cutting-edge product is set to revolutionize the way healthcare practices manage their financial operations by providing a state-of-the-art Financial System of Record that identifies revenue leakage and cost savings opportunities across back office operations.They are seeking a talented Staff Backend Engineer to join our team and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of healthcare technology.About The RoleAs a Staff Backend Engineer on the team, you would be responsible for delivering key products in the pipeline, enabling them to scale to thousands of healthcare practices.They will have a combination of both directly user-facing products as well as interfaces for other engineering teams. You will be building features that range from building for usability to scaling for massive growth and a wide array of engineering requirements.You’ll be working on defining, driving, and delivering the technical roadmap of the team and defining the underlying infrastructure for the next 5 years and beyond.What You’ll Do Work closely with Product Managers, designers and the business to create user-friendly product features.  Produce quality software that is shipped incrementally and continually at a high velocity  Have a lot of clear ownership over various parts of the product  Collaborate cross-functionally with designers, PMs, and fellow engineers to plan features to help bring a high quality product to market  Stay up-to-date with the latest backend technologies and Generative AI technologies, and incorporate them into the product development process.  Ensure the performance, scalability, and reliability of backend systems to handle high traffic and support a large user base.  Implement data storage and retrieval mechanisms to support content creation, editing, and sharing.  Identify and address security vulnerabilities to protect user data and ensure the integrity of the platform.  Work on optimizing database queries and caching strategies to improve system efficiency and response times.  Participate in code reviews and technical discussions to maintain code quality and promote best practices within the team.  Troubleshoot and resolve backend issues and bugs, ensuring the stability and smooth operation of the platform.  Interact with early customers and support them in being successful with the new product  Provide thoughtful feedback to your peers, and benefit from strong mentorship yourself  Acting as a technical leader and an owner of the product vertical. Qualifications: BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience  7+ years of experience developing systems/software for large business environments (Typescript, Python, Go preferred)  5+ years of experience designing complex systems, management products or business applications  Strong OOD and SOA principles, with ability to implement them in a language of choice  Strong experience leading design and implementation of robust and highly scalable services  Skilled in software development lifecycle processes and experience with scrum, agile and iterative approaches  Expertise with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD)  Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions.  Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSql technologies (Cassandra, ScyllaDB, ElasticSearch, Redis, DynamoDB), Sql Technologies (PostgresSQL), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, Azure Service Bus, etc)  Hands on experience with AWS services like S3, Lambdas, EC2 instances.  Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc.  You have seen systems operating at a significant technical and organizational scale  Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Salary Range: $150,000 - $200,000 base + equity

title: Field Engineer
job_description: Job DescriptionGeneral Responsibilities:Provide engineering and consulting services for a broad array of projects and clients. This may include performing and/or leading field investigations, engineering analysis, calculations, and recommendations, design and development of plans and specifications, observation and inspection, and the writing, preparation, and review of related reports for the services provided. Review drawings and construction to assure compliance with plans and specifications. Prepare proposals and cost estimates, track and evaluate project progress, budgets, and recommend changes. Research and resolve design and construction problems. Assign, review, and evaluate laboratory or field data for inclusion in reports. Apply sound engineering principles and be able to communicate complex engineering issues and concepts to technical and non-technical clients and project teams. Services may be provided for existing or proposed projects in the public works, transportation, commercial, communications, energy, and/or industrial sectors.Essential Roles And ResponsibilitiesFollow safety rules, guidelines and standards for all projects. Participate in pre-task planning. Report any safety issues or concerns to managementMaintain quality standards on all projects.Developing engineering professional; assignments are designed to develop knowledge and abilities.Assist in research, data collection, field observation, inspection, and field and laboratory testing. Prepare associated reports or sections of larger reports.Evaluate mostly routine laboratory and field data for inclusion in reports.Consult with other technical people and supervisor on routine and less complex projects.May perform basic calculations and engineering analysis Drafts routine proposals and assists in the preparation of more complex proposals.Performs plan drafting using CAD software. May work with engineering technician crews in testing, observations and data gathering activities on project sites and prepare daily reports documenting activities and findings.Works under the supervision of a Professional Engineer.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history. Preferred Certification:Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Engineering Intern (EI) designationAbout TerraconTerracon is a 100 percent employee-owned multidiscipline consulting firm comprised of more than 6,000 curious minds focused on solving engineering and technical challenges from more than 175 locations nationwide. Since 1965, Terracon has evolved into a successful multi-discipline firm specializing in environmental, facilities, geotechnical, and materials services. Terracon’s growth is due to our talented employee-owners exceeding expectations in client service and growing their careers with new and exciting opportunities in the marketplace.Terracon’s vision of “Together, we are best at people” is demonstrated through our excellent compensation and benefits package. Based on eligibility, role and job status, we offer many programs including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, paid time off and holidays, education reimbursement, and various bonus programs.EEO StatementTerracon is an EEO employer. We encourage qualified minority, female, veteran and disabled candidates to apply and be considered for open positions. We do not discriminate against any applicant for employment, or any employee because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender, disability, age, or military status.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Backend
job_description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch : Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best candidate for our clients. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire.Our ClientOur client is an innovative, venture-backed health-tech startup operating in stealth mode.They are building the modern financial OS for the new era of healthcare. In this era, humans and machines collaborate seamlessly to deliver effective and efficient patient care. However, to realize this vision, we must tackle a core industry-wide challenge: the fragmented financial data within healthcare practices. Our cutting-edge product is set to revolutionize the way healthcare practices manage their financial operations by providing a state-of-the-art Financial System of Record that identifies revenue leakage and cost savings opportunities across back office operations.They are seeking a talented Staff Backend Engineer to join our team and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of healthcare technology.About The RoleAs a Staff Backend Engineer on the team, you would be responsible for delivering key products in the pipeline, enabling them to scale to thousands of healthcare practices.They will have a combination of both directly user-facing products as well as interfaces for other engineering teams. You will be building features that range from building for usability to scaling for massive growth and a wide array of engineering requirements.You’ll be working on defining, driving, and delivering the technical roadmap of the team and defining the underlying infrastructure for the next 5 years and beyond.What You’ll Do Work closely with Product Managers, designers and the business to create user-friendly product features.  Produce quality software that is shipped incrementally and continually at a high velocity  Have a lot of clear ownership over various parts of the product  Collaborate cross-functionally with designers, PMs, and fellow engineers to plan features to help bring a high quality product to market  Stay up-to-date with the latest backend technologies and Generative AI technologies, and incorporate them into the product development process.  Ensure the performance, scalability, and reliability of backend systems to handle high traffic and support a large user base.  Implement data storage and retrieval mechanisms to support content creation, editing, and sharing.  Identify and address security vulnerabilities to protect user data and ensure the integrity of the platform.  Work on optimizing database queries and caching strategies to improve system efficiency and response times.  Participate in code reviews and technical discussions to maintain code quality and promote best practices within the team.  Troubleshoot and resolve backend issues and bugs, ensuring the stability and smooth operation of the platform.  Interact with early customers and support them in being successful with the new product  Provide thoughtful feedback to your peers, and benefit from strong mentorship yourself  Acting as a technical leader and an owner of the product vertical. Qualifications: BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience  7+ years of experience developing systems/software for large business environments (Typescript, Python, Go preferred)  5+ years of experience designing complex systems, management products or business applications  Strong OOD and SOA principles, with ability to implement them in a language of choice  Strong experience leading design and implementation of robust and highly scalable services  Skilled in software development lifecycle processes and experience with scrum, agile and iterative approaches  Expertise with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD)  Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions.  Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSql technologies (Cassandra, ScyllaDB, ElasticSearch, Redis, DynamoDB), Sql Technologies (PostgresSQL), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, Azure Service Bus, etc)  Hands on experience with AWS services like S3, Lambdas, EC2 instances.  Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc.  You have seen systems operating at a significant technical and organizational scale  Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Salary Range: $150,000 - $200,000 base + equity

title: Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Position SummaryIn today’s world, timely and accurate intelligence is one of the most valuable commodities of the military. As an Air National Guard intelligence analyst, you’ll serve in the state you want and receive the training required to gather and analyze intelligence from a target network of communications to determine the value and implications. And with thorough research and assessment, you’ll determine the actions and intentions of our adversaries and disseminate that information to high-level decision makers.Primary ResponsibilitiesIsolate essential elements of information.Analyze and report intelligence information.Gain and maintain knowledge of global communications procedures.Exploit global communications to support computer network operations.Advise commanders on force protection and intelligence information.BenefitsUp to 30 days of vacation with pay each yearExcellent healthcare coverage for you and your familyFood and housing assistanceFlexibility in location and schedulingA generous retirement programPrestigious leadership, training and continuing education opportunitiesFree or low-cost world travel opportunitiesExcellent starting salaryQualificationsTo be considered you must meet the following requirements:Have a high school diploma, GED or technical school diploma or certificate.Successfully complete a polygraph test.Completion of a current Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) and Top Secret clearanceNo speech disorders or noticeable communication deficienciesCompletion of 8.5 weeks of Basic Military TrainingMust be between the ages of 17 and 39Once you’ve finished applying, a recruiter will contact you regarding the next steps.About the Air National GuardThe Air National Guard is a unique military branch that offers careers and opportunities you won’t find in any other organization on the planet. Plus you get to serve in a way that fits your lifestyle. That means serving close to home in a role that best suits you, all while building strength in the communities you serve, both locally and globally.
Industries: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Military and International Affairs, and Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing

title: 12Y Geospatial Engineer
job_description: You can play an important part in disaster relief missions as a Geospatial Engineer for the Army National Guard. In this role, you will extract and supply geographic data that supports military operations of all kinds and help commanders visualize the battlefield during combat.As a Geospatial Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to collect and process military geographic information from decentralized sources (remote sensed imagery, digital data, intelligence data, existing topographic products, and other collateral data sources), present this information to leaders, and return decisions to the field.You May Also Supervise topographic surveying, cartography, and photolithography activities Assist in topographic planning and control activities Assist in determining requirements and providing technical supervision of geographic intelligence programsJob Duties Create geographic data and compile them into maps Create and maintain multiple geospatial databases Prepare military-style briefs covering all aspects of the terrainSome Of The Skills You’ll Learn Basic knowledge of Geographic Information Systems Imagery interpretation and exploitationHelpful Skills Interest in geography, maps, and charts Ability to demonstrate basic computer skills and work with drafting equipment Conceptualize ideas into computer-generated 2-D/3-D geospatial products Preference for a technical career fieldThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with construction, engineering, and architectural firms, as well as with government agencies as a surveyor, mapmaker, cartographer, cartographic technician, or photogrammetrist.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Geospatial Engineer requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 20 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practical application of geographic information systems. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.
Industries: Construction, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Civil Engineering

title: Reliability Engineer - T&D
job_description: JOB TITLE: Reliability Engineer - T&DREQUISITION: DIS00QKDEPARTMENT: Transmission & Distribution Asset Management – Topeka Operations CenterLOCATION: Topeka, KansasPay RangeEngineer I: $64,100 - $80,100 - $96,100Engineer II: $78,200 - $97,800 - $117,400Staff Engineer: $87,400 - $109,300 - $131,200Sr Engineer: $88,500 - $118,000 - $147,500Scheduled Work Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Other hours as required)Summary Of Primary Duties And ResponsibilitiesThe Reliability Engineer implements and facilitates reliability principals / processes, provides direction and technical expertise required to achieve and sustain optimum reliability, maintainability, useful life of assets at the lowest life cycle cost. The Reliability Engineer develops studies, plans, criteria, evaluations, performance assessments, cost estimates and budgets. Provides consultation and recommendations to the Company and to other business units. Provide technical consultation services in the areas of reliability, work and materials management, and business administration. Assist in financial justification of equipment reliability upgrades and improvements using return on investment tools such as Life Cycle Costing (LCC) and risk analysis. Facilitate and/or lead the implementation of Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) methods. Assist with field equipment monitor implementation and integration of associated data into equipment health formulas and work management system. Facilitate equipment criticality strategy and ranking sessions for new assets and periodically review existing rankings as the business model changes. Stay abreast of new technology and recommend implementation based on criticality, cost, and associated risk Monitor and evaluate asset bad actor lists. Develops and maintains critical spares strategy. Perform studies on equipment and process failures and present details of the analysis, in report format, to management. Develop work process and procedures for the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS). Clean and maintain CMMS data. Learn / use business analytic tools to visualize and manage data for the operations departments. Application of engineering principles to a broad range of requirements Collects and compiles financial data for budget and actual costs of projects Perform other work as assigned.Education And Experience RequirementsRequires a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Industrial, Civil, or Electrical Engineering from an ABET* accredited program. The preferred candidate will have 3-5 years of relevant experience. Relevant experience includes utility experience (power gen, transmission, substation, or distribution) or experience serving as a reliability engineer under a formal asset management program.Skills, Knowledge, And Abilities RequiredThe successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Requires knowledge of engineering principles. Requires knowledge of business environments and understanding of common business procedures. Experience leading or facilitating meetings or projects. Ability to read and understand technical documents including operations and maintenance manuals, technical drawings, schematics, logic diagrams and safety materials. Prefer use and understanding of computer applications and databases. Basic understanding of utility operations, maintenance, and business activities and practices. Ability to devise new approaches to problems encountered in the technical environment. Knowledge of transmission, substation, and/or distribution equipment and systems. Ability to participate constructively in work teams to facilitate and implement improvements to operations, maintenance, and business practices. Ability to handle multiple priorities, meet strict deadlines and work well under pressure on individual and team related basis.Licenses, Certifications, Bonding, And/or Testing RequiredValid driver's license required. Certified Maintenance and Reliability Professional (CMRP), Certified Reliability Leader, or Certified Reliability Engineer preferred.Working ConditionsConditions will vary between office and field environments. Travel will be required to support the operational groups. Travel to other locations within the company is required. Additional overnight travel may be required occasionally. Must have a satisfactory work record including good attendance. Work may require additional hours including evenings, nights, weekends, and holidays depending on workload, project deadlines, and service restoration efforts.Evergy has a clear mission – To empower a better future. Evergy chooses to live this mission by valuing People First. We know that to lead the responsible energy transition and provide affordable, reliable, and sustainable service to our customers and communities, we need a team with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. So, our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities we serve. We are committed to celebrating diversity and building a team where everyone – regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status – has a voice and can bring their best every day. We know that the more diverse and inclusive we are, the better we will be. Evergy is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.Disclaimer: The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.Work LocationsTopeka Operations CenterJobEngineeringUnposting DateApr 29, 2024

title: Vice President, Data Services
job_description: DescriptionCompany OverviewShamrock Trading Corporation is the parent company for a family of brands in transportation services, finance and technology. Headquartered in Overland Park, KS, Shamrock is frequently recognized among the “Best Places to Work” in Kansas City and Chicago and was most recently recognized as one of America’s top 100 “Most Loved Workplaces” by Newsweek. We also have offices in Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Ft. Lauderdale, Houston, Laredo, Nashville and Phoenix.With an average annual revenue growth of 25% over several decades, Shamrock’s success is attributed to three key factors: hiring the best people, cultivating long-term relationships with our customers and continually evolving in the marketplace.ResponsibilitiesShamrock Trading Corporation is looking for a Vice President, Data Services to lead a growing data team. This individual will lead a team of engineers in modernizing Shamrock’s enterprise data services. They will partner and collaborate with stakeholders, IT leaders, and external partners to understand strategic opportunities, guide data innovation, and deliver impactful data solutions. They will be responsible for building and managing our data platform to provide our stakeholders with a single source of truth for their data needs. Design and deliver data solutions that power strategic initiatives, business analytics, machine learning, and data science. Set the direction of data governance to ensure a reliable, accurate, and performant data pipeline is available for the growing enterprise. The Vice President, Data Services at Shamrock will lead with both expertise and inspiration, fostering an environment where complex problem-solving and creative engineering flourish, responsible for:Develop and communicate a clear vision of the data services technical future, ensuring alignment with business goals and market trendsEstablish, own, and oversee data engineering best practices and enterprise data platform development, while focused on data architecture, data accessibility, data ingestion, data visualization, operational reporting, and analyticsEncourage a culture of innovation that balances cutting-edge development with practical, scalable solution by successfully building and leading the corporate data strategyDemonstrate your deep understanding of data engineering through leading, mentoring, guiding, and growing a team of talented engineers to deliver cutting edge solutions to meet the needs of the businessEnsure the highest level of data availability, developing and implementing processes that ensure the stability and performance of our data applicationsClearly communicate engineering capacity and velocity, while serving as a coach to help business stakeholders and the data team prioritize work effectivelyResponsible for data management services within the enterprise including data ingestion, data processing, data storage, and data usage within a data platformBuild collaborative relationships by working closely with cross-functional business and technical teams to refine engineering processes, aligning them with business requirements and technical visionLead the implementation of enterprise data pipeline(s) to support analytics, reporting, and machine learning initiativesElevate your team through coaching, professional development, and leading by example in data engineering craftsmanshipQualificationsProven experience in a leadership role within software engineering, ideally in transportation/financial technology or similar high-stakes, high-volume environments.A deep understanding of technical data solutions and systems, ideally in the areas of data ingestion, API, data models, and data storage.A results-oriented track record of successful technical strategy development and execution of simultaneous strategic initiatives.Strong management and coaching skills, with experience in mentoring senior engineers and fostering a culture of continues improvement and excellence.Exceptional strategic thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills fostering innovation solutions to keep the business moving forward.Expertise in database systems (e.g. Postgres, MS SQL, Redshift, MongoDB) and familiarity with tools like Git, Jenkins, JIRA, and Confluence.Experience ingesting, extracting, and manipulating data sets from a variety of sources, primarily cloud-based real-time data source, with focus on data governance into an enterprise data platform (e.g. Databricks).A STEM background, coupled with a passion for transportation and financial markets and an appetite for tackling complex, distributed systems.Experience with designing, implementing, loading, and indexing relational data structures.Bachelor’s degree, in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Science or related technical field, plus 12+ years of data engineering and leadership experience.Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineer, MBA, Data Engineering is a plus.Excellent communication skills, both in distilling complex concepts and in collaborative project management.This leadership position requires an onsite presence at Corporate Headquarters in Overland Park, KS. Benefits PackageAt Shamrock we hire bright, ambitious people and give them the tools they need to be successful. By investing in training and development, we hope to become a long-term career for employees, where there are always opportunities for advancement. Shamrock also offers a premier set of benefits for employees and their families:Medical: Fully paid healthcare, dental and vision premiums for employees and eligible dependents Work-Life Balance: Competitive PTO and paid leave policies Financial: Generous company 401(k) contributions and employee stock ownership after one year Wellness: Onsite gym and discounted membership to select fitness centers. Jogging trails available at Overland Park offices

title: Performance Analyst
job_description: DescriptionAt MMGY, we believe nothing shapes your view of the world like travel. So every day, we share our client’s stories from a perspective that inspires people to see the world differently. Our personalized service and strategy connect media, consumers and influencers across the globe, taking people to new places and changing their view for the better. At MMGY we inspire people to go places.TravelDesk is a travel focused media partner delivering world class multi-channel campaigns for travel and tourism companies worldwide. We combine travel specific experience with proprietary data and extensive distribution options to help our travel-sector clients deliver on their business and marketing objectives.We have an immediate opening for a Performance Analyst in our Overland Park, KS office. The Performance Analyst will leverage data analysis and reporting tools to assist in the development and management of dashboards, data and insights visualisation, as well as optimization tools for programmatic campaigns run by TravelDesk. The Performance Analyst must possess a fundamental understanding of media, programmatic advertising, data analysis and visualization as well as having excellent written and communication skills. The role will help to drive efficiencies through platform expertise, data visualization, accurate reporting and automation.Duties & Responsibilities Assist with building and maintaining ‘client-facing’ campaign performance Tableau dashboards  Collect and analyze data from multiple sources and translate into insights for the TravelDesk team and clients  Work with TravelDesk team on ad hoc reporting requests  Coordinate data connections in performance reporting  Lead client/campaign analytics meetings, presenting insights and recommendations derived from multiple data sources  Collaborate with TravelDesk and MMGY Global teams to collect requirements for dashboard builds  Establish and adhere to internal deadlines  Work with the TravelDesk teams on custom client dashboard builds and PPT presentations from data produced from advertising campaigns.  Research latest technology and trends on data visualization best practices and communication  Responsible for maintaining ad hoc datasets  The role will also assist the TravelDesk team with client website analytics tracking implementation, development of marketing measurement and creative tagging strategies. Skills & Experience Needed Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Information Technology, Finance or similar  Intermediate Microsoft Excel knowledge (SQL experience is a plus)  1-2 years of business analytical work, specifically data visualization software experience; Tableau specific experience preferred  Awareness of client business issues, industry trends, consumer trends and media landscape  Knowledge of key digital/analytic tools/platforms: Google Ads, Campaign Manager, Google Analytics, Social platforms, Adobe Analytics, etc.  Comprehensive understanding of metrics: Media (e.g., impression, GRP, CPV, CVR, ROAS etc.) and Measurement analytics  Independent worker eager to demonstrate personal accountability  Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills  Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa. MMGY Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Who Are We? We’re a travel-obsessed collective of more than 600 people across the country and around the globe. And when we say we inspire people to go places, we mean ALL people. That’s why we’re focused on nurturing a workforce that’s as diverse as the places we visit — welcoming candidates of all ages, genders and gender identities; ethnicities and religions; people of color; LGBTQIA+ people and their allies; working parents; veterans; and those with disabilities.

title: Warehouse Management Software Engineer
job_description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, The Connors Group, Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!We are actively seeking a Senior WMS Engineer, a vital role in our organization, blending technical expertise in Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and Warehouse Execution Systems (WES) with a strategic vision for operational excellence. This position requires not only a robust understanding of WMS and ERP systems but also a proven track record in process re-engineering and optimization. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, essential for bridging the gap between operations and technology. In this Senior WMS Engineer role, you will be at the forefront of enhancing our warehouse operations through your expertise in WMS, WES, and ERP systems. Your skills in process optimization, combined with your ability to communicate effectively across departments, will drive our success in this rapidly evolving industry. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to create efficient, state-of-the-art warehouse operations, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.Key ResponsibilitiesWMS and WES Systems Administration: Act as the primary systems administrator for both WMS and WES, ensuring their stable and efficient operation. Responsibilities include system troubleshooting, upgrades, and maintenance. ? ERP Systems Expertise: Demonstrate a strong understanding of ERP systems and their integration with WMS and WES. Ensure that these systems work in harmony to support overall business objectives. Process Re-engineering and Optimization: Lead initiatives in process re-engineering to enhance warehouse efficiency. Implement optimization strategies to streamline operations, reduce costs, and increase productivity. New System Selection and Implementation: Spearhead the selection and implementation of new WMS solutions. Oversee their integration with ERP systems, ensuring a smooth and effective transition. Operational Management and Productivity Enhancement: Manage the daily operations of WMS and WES. Focus on leveraging these systems to improve warehouse productivity and operational efficiency. Support a flawless Back to School (Peak Season) experience for our customers through stable Warehouse operations of all applications Strategic Planning and Project Management: Develop strategic plans for warehouse operations. Lead projects focused on technology upgrades and process improvements, ensuring alignment with business goals. Communication and Collaboration: Utilize strong communication skills to effectively bridge the gap between operations and technology. Collaborate with various teams and departments, ensuring a unified approach to warehouse management. Best Practice Audits and Industry Expertise: Conduct audits and provide consultancy services, leveraging your deep knowledge of industry best practices in warehousing and material handling. Compliance and Best Practices Implementation: Maintain compliance with industry standards and regulations. Regularly update and enforce best practices for operational efficiency and safety.Warehouse Management Software EngineerKey Skills and Requirements:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research, or related field. 10+ years experience working with WMS, WES, and ERP Systems in a Warehouse Operations environment. 5+ years experience working in a Warehouse Operations environment with detailed understanding of how products and information flow through a modern warehouse Strong emphasis on the importance of collaboration with operations leadership to ensure technological initiatives are seamlessly integrated into operational strategies, enhancing overall efficiency and productivity Proven experience managing the evaluation, selection, delivery and performance of technology solution providers and offerings. Thorough understanding of modern application development frameworks. Demonstrated understanding and familiarity with standard IT process and application development methodologies. Knowledge of Fulfillment industry trends, market forces, regulatory environment and business strategy; must be able to translate business strategy into architecture requirements. Proven experience creating business-oriented presentations to communicate rationale for WMS investments and decisions Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and verbal communication skills in order to demonstrate thought leadership, promote guidelines/standards, establish oversight controls, facilitate solution design review among cross-functional stakeholder groups, establish buy-in, build consensus, surface key requirements, mentor associates and drive change, Proven ability in process re-engineering and optimization in a warehouse setting. Excellent communication skills to effectively liaise between operational and technological departments. Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.

title: Process Engineer – Hutchinson, KS
job_description: Nutrition - Specialty IngredientsThis is a full-time, exempt position.Position SummaryThe Hutchinson, KS Protein manufacturing facility is seeking a Process Engineer with the skills to improve and optimize processes utilizing historical data and standardized continuous improvement methods. The Process Engineer will utilize engineering skills to collaborate with all functional areas including operations, maintenance, EHS (Environmental Health & Safety), and QFS (Quality & Food Safety) to drive improvements through project execution from scope development to start-up. This position will work closely with Division Engineers, and Performance Excellence colleagues.Essential Job FunctionsOversight of specific processes that includes capital projects.This may include project management requiring project scope development, approval and funding authorization, equipment specification and purchasing, equipment installation, budget tracking, colleague training, contractor management, and project commissioning.Provide initial required training for contractors and oversee the SWP (Safe Work Permit) while contractors are on site.Utilize the MOC (Management of Change) process where required.Lead or participate in trouble shooting initiatives to provide corrective actions that work to meet Plant KPI goals in the areas of safety, quality, and operations.Identify improvement opportunities and lead continuous improvement initiatives in support of plant foals for safety, quality, cost, yield, and reliability.As a member of the plant leadership team be a champion and spokesperson for plant safety, quality, and operations initiatives.Manage downtime data collection and enter it in the appropriate location and utilize it to prioritize improvement initiatives.Work with colleagues to develop/update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and work instructions in compliance with EHS and QFS standards. Train colleagues after a SOP approval.Minimum Job Requirements:B.S. in Engineering.1 + years of food plant manufacturing experience helpful.Demonstrated commitment to safety.An understanding of Quality and Food Safety.Good critical thinking skills.Good written and verbal communication skills.Ability to look beyond the task at hand, anticipate challenges, and develop options to overcome them.Ability to collaborate and utilize all plant functions and resources to implement solutions.Ability to manage contractors performing project work on site.Ability to work in a hot, cold, or dusty environment that may require work on ladders, scaffolding or other elevated surfaces.Excited about this role but don’t meet every requirement listed? Studies show that often applicants will self-select out if they don’t check every box. We encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another one of our openings.ADM requires the successful completion of a background check.REF:82378BRBenefits And PerksEnriching the quality of life for the world begins by taking care of our colleagues. title: 12Y Geospatial Engineer
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionYou can play an important part in disaster relief missions as a Geospatial Engineer for the Army National Guard. In this role, you will extract and supply geographic data that supports military operations of all kinds and help commanders visualize the battlefield during combat.As a Geospatial Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to collect and process military geographic information from decentralized sources (remote sensed imagery, digital data, intelligence data, existing topographic products, and other collateral data sources), present this information to leaders, and return decisions to the field.You May Also Supervise topographic surveying, cartography, and photolithography activities Assist in topographic planning and control activities Assist in determining requirements and providing technical supervision of geographic intelligence programsJob Duties Create geographic data and compile them into maps Create and maintain multiple geospatial databases Prepare military-style briefs covering all aspects of the terrainSome Of The Skills You'll Learn Basic knowledge of Geographic Information Systems Imagery interpretation and exploitationHelpful Skills Interest in geography, maps, and charts Ability to demonstrate basic computer skills and work with drafting equipment Conceptualize ideas into computer-generated 2-D/3-D geospatial products Preference for a technical career fieldThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with construction, engineering, and architectural firms, as well as with government agencies as a surveyor, mapmaker, cartographer, cartographic technician, or photogrammetrist.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Geospatial Engineer requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 20 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practical application of geographic information systems. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingA monthly paycheckMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits available VA home loansBonuses, if applicable Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to changeRequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. title: Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Athenix Special Missions (ASM) is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer at the Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support (MTCCS)-Centers of Excellence (COE) Schools at Fort Leavenworth, KS. ASM Quality Policy: To meet or exceed customers' expectation for quality, delivery, and service through continual improvement, striving to meet our objectives, and committing to meeting all legal and statutory requirements. Summary: Athenix Special Missions is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer to provide Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support II (MTCCS) technical and functional Constructive Simulation and Gaming support to TRADOC Centers of Excellence (COE) and Schools. This work provides technical and functional end-to-end (simulation to Mission Command Systems (MCS)) training functionality using TRADOC Proponent OfficeConstructive (TPO-C) low overhead simulations and TRADOC Proponent OfficeVirtual & Gaming (TPO-V&G) games. Simulations and tools such as Army Games for Training (GFT), Virtual Battle Space (VBS), and Division eXercise Training and Review System (DXTRS) are employed to enhance staff training at the lower continuum of training thresholds with the purpose of enhancing Military Decision Making Process (MDMP) and staff training in each respective TRADOC Institutions training curriculum. Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:Shall be available between 08001700 hrs, Monday through Friday except Federal holidays or when the government facility is closed for administrative reasons.Provide assistance and support with the necessary resources for planning, preparation, setup, operation, troubleshooting of the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS hardware and software applications and functionality to support the following tasks:Preparation, setup and operation of the closed networks supporting the TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications.Preparation, setup and operation of the unclassified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the classified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the DIS component between applications.Provide exercise preparation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide exercise execution for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide unit database and scenario builds that includes planning, building, and loading, configuring and operating TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications/tools.MDMP preparation, setup and operation using TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS ToolsProvide end to end functional preparation, setup and operations from the simulation/tool to include the MCS.Provide terrain preparation, setup and operation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G terrain tools.Provide TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS troubleshooting expertise when technical and operational issues occur.When a TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS issue/deficiency is identified, troubleshoot a work-around and submit a Problem Trouble Report (PTR) to TPO-C using the PTR Tool located on the NSC SharePoint Site.Provide support to all simulations in support of other exercises, training events, and planning.Provide support to LVC-G and other simulations, as requested.Serve as a systems and network administrator. This task includes all computer and network functions and infrastructure affecting the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS tools.Develop and provide written records (meetings, conference, working groups, after action reports, etc.) for each supported exercise/event.Provide testing and validation support to the capability and material development of the TPO-C tools.Provide operational and functional support of the MCS.Develop and provide briefing/presentation for each supported exercise/event as required by the OSCOR.Develop and provide Exercise Technical Summary Report for each supported exercise/event.When required, provide TPO-C and TPO-V&G support to other than COE/Schools.Provide computer networking support.Maintain training content; update the MilGaming web site and its content: graphics, animations, scenarios, models, terrain, training support packages (TSPs), and videos.Installation, Operation, and Maintenance of TPO-C and TPO-V&G Applications; this includes troubleshooting and resolving TPO-C and TPO-V&G software, hardware and network problem, real-time editing, and backup/recovery of all TPO-C and TPO-V&G data elements.Configuration Management; Maintain TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications. Manage version control and continuous integration, for all configuration management requirements.Install, Configure and operate existing and Emerging Army Stimulation-to- command and control (C2) interfaces; configure TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, and peripheral equipment to interface with Army Stimulation MCS interfaces as required.Administer the TPO-C and TPO-V&G systems during exercises and training events; participate in After Action Reviews (AARs) IAW TC 25-20, manage the TPO-C and TPO-V&G security compliance activities, to include the design and development of TPO-C and TPO-V&G information technology (IT) strategies at the local level.Maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G furnished equipment; maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, peripheral equipment, MCS equipment that may be issued by others and other simulation related items.Participate in required TPO-C and TPO-V&G /Mission Command Training Support Program (MCTSP) program review; participate in exercise readiness review, initial planning reviews, systems requirements reviews, software and hardware specification and design reviews, and participates in TPO-C and TPO-V&G user conferences/developer working groups.Instruct training audience and personnel to operate TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS systems and tools. Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks.Four years' experience in software development, simulation integration within the Microsoft Windows and Linux family of operating systems; to include expertise in hardware and software standards and protocols; ability to apply architectures to real world requirements using current Live, Virtual, Constructive and Gaming (LVC-G) platforms.Two years of experience in software testing, analysis, troubleshooting, problem trouble reports development, management and documentation (PTRs), and operating current gaming suite toolkit.Shall have the ability to write programs using C++, MFC, C#, Visual Basic, JAVA, XML, scripting languages, X programming and libraries and shall integrate networking packet protocols into simulation environments.Experience in providing technical advice for gaming development as it relates to the (LVC-G) Training Environment.Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.Bachelor's degree or equivalent, any discipline, and three (3) years' experience in operating simulations, simulators, models, games and MCS.In lieu of a college degree, four (4) years' experience in database management and/or systems management on systems within JLCCTC, GFT and MCS may be substituted for a bachelor's degree. title: III Corps MTC Network Engineers with Security Clearance
job_description: REQ#: RQ129437 Requisition Type: Pipeline Your Impact Own your opportunity to work with the largest government agency in the nation. Make an impact by advancing the Department of Defense's mission to keep our country safe and secure. Job Description The primary function of the Mission Training Complex (MTC) Network Engineer is to plan, construct, and manage networks to ensure they are optimized and functioning as intended. The Network Engineer will perform as the overall communications architect and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) for the MTC and will coordinate with outside agencies and III Corps MTC sites. The Network Engineer will create/establish communications architecture, coordinate communications plans, configure communications equipment, implement Information Assurance (IA) processes, and assist in installing equipment and circuitry in support of distributed exercises. The Network Engineer coordinates all aspects of the communications architecture and exercise support plans with communications planners at other simulation facilities, the MTC, NEC, and participating tactical units. Plans include distribution of data, voice, and VTC over both LAN and WAN in both classified and unclassified modes for simulations/stimulation networks: NIPRNET, SIPRNET, and tactical networks. The MTC Network Engineer will serve as the ISSO for the MTC and will lead all contractor efforts in support of Risk Management Framework (RMF). WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED: Requirements: * Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or a related field A minimum of 10 years' experience in Network Architecture design and implementation Possess advanced planning, troubleshooting and maintenance skills on the Microsoft server platform and router, switch, and firewall configuration A strong understanding of technology integration and information flow including LAN/WAN, firewalls, security, storage, and backup methodologies. Knowledge of specific product lines (Cisco, Fujitsu, Hewlett Packard, and Tripwire) Must fully understand the DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF) Certification and Accreditation process and Cyber Security requirements IAT Level II, and Computing Environment (CE) certification TS/SCI GDIT IS YOUR PLACE: * 401K with company match Comprehensive health and wellness packages Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications Cutting-edge technology you can learn from #fortriley Work Requirements .cls-1{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px} Years of Experience 6 + years of related experience * may vary based on technical training, certification(s), or degree .cls-2{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px} Certification Travel Required Less than 10% Salary and Benefit Information The likely salary range for this position is $92,331 - $154,211. This is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary. Rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range. View information about benefits and our total rewards program. About Our Work We are GDIT. A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.S. government, defense and intelligence community. Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation. We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development. Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher
job_description: Position OverviewThe Kansas University Center on Developmental Disabilities (KUCDD) is seeking a highly motivated individual with specialized training as a quantitative methodologist or a data engineer with an interest in engineering flexible data systems for funded projects to fill a full-time, grant-funded postdoctoral researcher position. The position requires someone who is interested in joining a collaborative team of data scientists at the center who can balance demands across multiple funded projects in a rapidly evolving, research-intensive environment. The postdoc will also work with an inclusive research team at KUCDD, participating in designing and implementing data science methods in full participation with people with disabilities and researchers from a variety of disciplines. The individual filling this position will work on projects within KUCDD to contribute to the development of new and existing funded research projects. As a member of collaborative team, the individual filling this position will engage in various data science activities, such as, (a) customizing data collection systems; (b) organizing, modeling, and reporting data; (c) supporting research grant development by conducting power analyses, research design, and data analyses, and (d) author or co-author scientific papers.The postdoctoral researcher position at KUCDD will be limited term through August 31, 2025, with the possibility of renewal. This is a full-time, grant-funded position with a salary range of $55,000 - $60,000 annually, plus benefits, depending on experience and qualifications. The position will be reevaluated each year with the possibility for renewal for an additional year.Unit Description:The Kansas University Center on Developmental Disabilities (KUCDD; http://kucdd.ku.edu/) has a mission to ensure individuals with developmental disabilities have opportunities to make decisions regarding their participation in society and quality of life. KUCDD is recognized as a leading research center in the field of disability, implementing and conducting grant-funded projects focusing on both applied research and interdisciplinary training in disability and disability research methods.KUCDD is committed to fostering a welcoming and inclusive work culture that respects all individuals. In a continuing effort to enrich its academic environment and provide equal educational and employment opportunities, KUCDD actively encourages applications from members of marginalized groups in higher education, including people with disabilities.Job DescriptionUnder the supervision of the Director of the Data Science Unit in KUCDD, the postdoctoral researcher will be focused on building their general data science portfolio while advancing research in the disability field and working as part of an inclusive research team. As a postdoctoral researcher at KUCDD, the individual will gain extensive grant writing experience, increase their publication record, and sharpen their data science skillsets with real data. They will also participate in postdoctoral training and mentorship activities. As a member of the data team at KUCDD, responsibilities will include:60% - Data Science Support for Project ImplementationWith mentorship from other members of the data science team as well as the broader staff at KUCDD, the individual in this postdoctoral researcher position will assist different research teams in problem-solving the collecting, managing, and writing scripts to clean, organize, analyze, and report data using major statistical packages such as SAS, R, or Mplus. They will have the opportunity to visualize data for multiple audiences. They will learn to prepare and share datasets (along with data dictionaries) and scripts in public data repositories. In addition, they will help pre-register new studies and develop registered reports. They will also contribute to programming and customizing features in online data collection systems, such as, Qualtrics (e.g., JavaScript, CSS, and HTML) for funded projects.20% - Contribution to Grant Preparation ActivitiesWith mentorship from other members of the data science team and the broader staff at KUCDD, the individual in this postdoctoral researcher position will gain hands-on experience in actively supporting and learning from investigators affiliated with KUCDD in the development of grant applications, including, but not limited to, selecting research designs, designing analysis plans, and running simulation- based power analyses.20% - Dissemination of Research FindingsWith mentorship from other members of the data science team, the individual will contribute to the statistical analyses related to ongoing Center grant-funded data collection. They will learn to prepare statistical methods and results sections for manuscripts submitted for publication or presentations for conferences or other professional meetings that are accessible to a general audience, including people with disabilities.Required QualificationsA doctoral degree in quantitative methods, computer science, data science, or related field.Two years applied experience with a major statistical package such as SAS, R, or Mplus, as evidenced by application materials or interview.Two years applied experience conducting data queries on given data spreadsheets, writing scripts to clean data, merging data sets, recoding variables, and creating composite scores, as evidenced by application materials or interview.One year experience implementing and interpreting output from advanced statistical analyses, such as applications of multilevel modeling, structural equation modeling, and measurement models for at least one project, as evidenced by application materials or interview.NOTE: To be appointed at the Postdoctoral Researcher title, it is necessary to have the PhD in hand. Appointments made without a diploma or certified transcript indicating an earned doctorate are conditional hires and are appointed on an acting basis.Preferred QualificationsCompleted coursework in advanced statistical methods, such as, Bayesian statistics, multilevel modeling, or structural equation modeling.Completed coursework in data management, data engineering, or data systems.Contributed to the methods section of at least one previously submitted grant application.One publication or presentation using advanced statistical analyses, such as, multilevel modeling, structural equation modeling, or measurement validation study.One method-focused publication or presentation such as a methods tutorial, simulation-based research, or other type of paper that advances quantitative methodology.Experience in data visualization (e.g., creating charts) in Tableau, R, or other software for at least one project. Demonstrated contributions to the creation of at least one online survey questionnaire using platforms like Qualtrics or Survey Monkey, as evidenced by application materials or interview.Additional Candidate InstructionsIn addition to the online application form, applicants should include the following information in their application:A cover letter addressing how required and preferred qualifications are met.C.V.Contact information for three professional references. At least one of the references must be a current or former supervisor/advisor.Application review begins Monday, May 20th. For priority consideration, apply by Sunday, May 19th. Contact Information to ApplicantsTyler Hicks, Ph.D.Assistant Research Professor, University of Kansas,Director of Quantitative Research, Kansas University Center of Developmental Disabilitiestahicks@ku.eduAdvertised Salary Range$55,000-$60,000Work ScheduleMonday - Friday, 40 hours/weekApplication Review BeginsMonday May 20, 2024Anticipated Start DateMonday August 5, 2024

title: Civil CAD Technician
job_description: In 2023, we changed our name from Anderson Engineering, Inc. to OWN, Inc. to be more reflective of our team and the mindset that makes us go. While the name may be new, the links to the past have led us to what we are today: a community of talented employee-owners driven by mutual success.OWN, Inc. is an engineering firm that believes in the power of employee-ownership. Our talented team builds futures while helping shape the built environment across the country from our offices in Missouri, Kansas, Arkansas, and Florida. We serve the Private Development and Public Infrastructure markets with core offerings of Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Land Surveying, and Field Services. No matter the project or scope, our clients enjoy problem-solving and service that goes beyond the expected.We are looking for a Civil CAD Technician to join our Overland Park, Kansas team.Responsibilities May IncludeGather data and perform research to support daily projects.Read and interpret plans and specifications to gain a comprehensive understanding of project requirements.Conduct various office tasks, including research and preparation of CAD files for construction documents, as well as review deeds and title work information.Utilize engineer and survey drawings to create bid documents.Prepare precise CAD drawings using AutoCAD and Civil 3-D software.Collaborate effectively in a team environment, demonstrating self-motivation and a strong customer service orientation.Demonstrate excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.Be available to work overtime as needed to meet project deadlines.Perform any other duties assigned by the supervisor.Required Skills/Abilities2+ years of CAD related drafting/design experience.Proficiency in preparing CAD drawings with attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to effectively utilize AutoCAD and Civil 3-D software to create high-quality drawings.Strong teamwork skills, self-motivation, and a commitment to providing exceptional customer service.Willingness to learn and adapt, even if you don't possess all the desired skills for this position.Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills to collaborate with colleagues and clients effectively.When you join us, you can find your OWN way through:Community. Giving of time, treasures, and talents to fulfill personal passions and show up in your community.Empowerment. Our employees are given full reign and the trust to make decisions in the best interest of their clients and teams.Flexibility. The freedom to be a professional. The freedom to be a person.ESOP. Our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) is owned 100% by employees – equitably, a fact most employee-owned firms can’t claim.Having fun. Laughing, jokes, high fives, celebrations – we take our work seriously but not ourselves.Teamwork. A sense of belonging, learning from those around you, and feeling like you’re on the winning team.It is the policy of OWN, Inc. to provide equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to their race, age, color, physical handicap or disability, military service record, religion, sex, national origin or any other categorization protected by law, and to promote the full realization of equal employment opportunity through a positive continuing program.

title: Technical Sales Consultant
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
job_description: What will you do?  Are you a highly motivated IIoT Automation Engineer with a passion for leveraging technology to solve complex industrial problems? If so, we want you to join our team as a Technical Sales Consultant. The successful candidate will be responsible for helping create solutions with our newest IIoT-based product offer. Solutions will be focused on midstream, upstream, and water/wastewater automation.  The successful candidate will work closely with other TSCs, internal and external sales staff to develop solutions to help customers with their IIoT-based solutions.  What skills and capabilities will make you successful?  Effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team are essential for success in this role. Travel: In this role, the successful candidate will be required to travel frequently across the United States and Canada to meet with customers and provide technical knowledge, expertise and training. The ability to travel up to 60% of the time is essential for this position. What's in it for you?  Not only is Schneider-Electric a great company to work for! You will be part of a customer first driven Team that is exciting and works well together. You will get to experience new challenges every day and leverage technology to solve complex industrial problems  Who will you report to?  Nicholas Smith- NAM Technical Sales Consultant Manager  What qualifications will make you successful for this role?  The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree or Technologist Diploma in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a similar discipline.  You should have experience with Linux platforms such as Raspberry Pi, Beagle, or Libre, as well as knowledge of container technology (e.g., Docker) and general-purpose programming languages such as Python or C/C++/C#. You should also be a self-starter with the ability to quickly learn new technologies, programming languages, and platforms Desired qualifications: include experience with cloud-based infrastructures and data management in IIoT, automation systems such as SCADA, RTUs, and PLCs, and automation protocols such as MQTT, Sparkplug B, OPC UA, Modbus, DNP3, and EthernetIP. Familiarity with IT infrastructure and/or OT Security including Active Directory, Azure AD is also desirable. If you are a talented and motivated IIoT Automation Engineer with a background in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science, apply now to become a Technical Sales Consultant and help solve complex industrial problems.  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
